title: Gowanus Canal - Brooklyn - Hamilton Avenue Bridge - [9th Street (West).]

text:
(1)

Gowanus Canal: A view from north of Hamilton Ave., to the West 9th Street Bridge, showing barges at the left unloading coal at the Brooklyn Union Gas Company.

April 4, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, showing a close-up of the right foreground.

October 11, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Gowanus Canal - Brooklyn - Hamiton Avenue - West 9th Street Bridge - [Brooklyn Union Gas Company].

text:
Gowanus Canal (Brooklyn) : Viewing north from Hamilton Avenue and showing the industrial aspects of the waterfront and the West 9th Street bridge which carries the Independent System Subway.

P.L. Sperr

October 11, 1933
Views 1,2

Gowanus Canal (Brooklyn) : Viewing north from Hamilton Avenue and showing the industrial aspects of the waterfront and the West 9th Street bridge which carries the Independent System Subway.

P.L. Sperr

October 11, 1933
Views 1,2

(1)
West 9th Street, west from Hamilton Avenue. The houses on the south side of the street (left) were demolished later in the year to make way for the Red Hook housing project sponsored by the New York City Housing Authority.

June 9, 1938

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same, at a later date, showing the housing center under construction.

April 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr

(1)
West 9th Street, west from Hamilton Avenue. The houses on the south side of the street (left) were demolished later in the year to make way for the Red Hook housing project sponsored by the New York City Housing Authority.

June 9, 1938

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same, at a later date, showing the housing center under construction.

April 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr

-- 1-West 9th Street, east from and across Hamilton Avenue. The Red Hook government houses are being built behind the fence on the right.
View 1: April 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr

2,3-Buildings on the east side of Hamilton Avenue were torn down to make way for the widening of the avenue and the construction of Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system.
Views 2,3: October 23, 1940

P. L. Sperr

-- 1-West 9th Street, east from and across Hamilton Avenue. The Red Hook government houses are being built behind the fence on the right.
View 1: April 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr

2,3-Buildings on the east side of Hamilton Avenue were torn down to make way for the widening of the avenue and the construction of Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system.
Views 2,3: October 23, 1940

P. L. Sperr

-- 1-West 9th Street, east from and across Hamilton Avenue. The Red Hook government houses are being built behind the fence on the right.
View 1: April 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr

2,3-Buildings on the east side of Hamilton Avenue were torn down to make way for the widening of the avenue and the construction of Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system.
Views 2,3: October 23, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Clinton Street, at West 9th Street. Shown are two general views, in a southwesterly direction, of the Red Hook Houses under construction, a low rent, government-sponsored housing development. In the foreground of view 2 is Hamilton Avenue (trolley thereon), where excavation is going on which will transform the avenue into the northerly extension of the Belt Parkway.

April 9, 1939
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Clinton Street, at West 9th Street. Shown are two general views, in a southwesterly direction, of the Red Hook Houses under construction, a low rent, government-sponsored housing development. In the foreground of view 2 is Hamilton Avenue (trolley thereon), where excavation is going on which will transform the avenue into the northerly extension of the Belt Parkway.

April 9, 1939
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Gowanus Canal (Brooklyn): Looking north along the industrial waterfront of the canal from Hamilton Avenue. Shown, too, is the new West 9th Street bridge over which runs the Independent subway. View 3 is from the subway bridge.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: September 7, 1940
Views 2,3: October 23, 1940
